Or, if the right side of the nose is represented, it must 
appear directed to the right of the spectator in all 
situations; and eyes that turn in a due degree from 
that direction toward the spectator, so as to look at him 
when viewed in front, will continue to do so when 
viewed obliquely.

of the nose & eyes in a portrait, if a compass be 
represented Plate IV in front of the picture in a square box, so placed that
